details: Acts on gastric organs as a tonic. (GENTIAN; HYDR.) Seems to possess marked action on eyes, producing amblyopia and cataract. Pain in right intercostal muscles above the liver. Pressure and stitches in liver, and sympathetically in spleen.

Extremities: Cold extremities, with sensation of internal coldness
Stomach: Atonic dyspepsia, with gas and acidity
Dyspepsia after infectious diseases; especially grip, dysentery
Tongue dry or with brown sticky coating
Excessive desire - impossible to retain urine; copious micturition day and night
As soon as the child wakes up the bed is drenched

name: Quassia
dosage: First to third potency, or spoonful doses of Aqua Quassia.
